instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01521-A Liquid
threads.message: hello I have 1 motherboard 820-01521-a that took liquid in the u3200 in the Q7760 I changed the 2 components, but I don't have 20V in the F3000-F3010, who generates 20 volts?

threads.title: 820-01521-A Liquid
threads.message:
Do you get any voltage at USB-C meter?
Both ports have the same behaviour?

Post exact PPBUS_G3H voltage.

threads.title: 820-01521-A Liquid
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H   
starts with 12v then goes down to 8v and then goes up again 12v is not stable.
f3010 no I get 20v only 4.5v

threads.title: 820-01521-A Liquid
threads.message:
Check for short on all secondary power rails.
Do you get stable voltage at R7020?
You may need to reflow/reball U7000.

threads.title: 820-01521-A Liquid
threads.message: I have this in short bat i cheng this with new ic ?

threads.title: 820-01521-A Liquid
threads.message: I removed them from another working motherboard :cry:
